Package com.payd.shooti.ui.screens

Class UIScreen

java.lang.Object
com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor
com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Group
com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.WidgetGroup
com.payd.shooti.ui.actors.UIGroup
com.payd.shooti.ui.screens.UIScreen
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.utils.Cullable, com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.utils.Layout, IUIElement, IUIResize
Direct Known Subclasses:
ArenaStartedSplashUI, DebugUI, DungeonGameUI, InGameHUD, LoungeUI, OverlayMenu, ScoreboardUI, SplashUI, StashHouseUI, WeaponDebugUI
public abstract class UIScreen extends UIGroup implements IUIResize
Base class for all UI screens. Provides helper functions for listeners and screen transitions. Can be consumed by the UI class. Has built-in goBack functionality on the ESCAPE key.
See Also:
  • UI

    • rootTable

      protected UITable rootTable()
      Called when the screen is entered. Can be overridden to return a custom table.
      See Also:
      • UITable

    • getSafeZoneWidth

      public float getSafeZoneWidth()

    • getSafeZoneHeight

      public float getSafeZoneHeight()

    • goBack

      protected void goBack()
      Called when a BackButton or the ESCAPE key button is pressed. Removes keyboard focus and event listeners.
      See Also:
      • UI.goBack()

    • initListeners

      protected void initListeners()
      Called on instantiation and adds all listeners to the screen. Override this method to add listeners to the screen. The escape key is automatically added to goBack.

    • clearListeners

      public void clearListeners()
      Overrides:
      clearListeners in class com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor

    • onKeyPress

      protected void onKeyPress(int code, Runnable action)
      Helper function to add a key listener to the screen. Can consume Input.Keys or integer keycodes. The pressed key would be gated from further listeners.

    • onKeyRelease

      protected void onKeyRelease(int code, Runnable action)

    • suppressPlayerControl

      protected void suppressPlayerControl()
      Helper function to block all player movement while the screen is active by adding listeners to movement keys

    • getAlpha

      public float getAlpha()

    • getMouseQuadrant

      public int getMouseQuadrant(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 mousePos)
      Returns the quadrant in which the mouse position is located relative to the center of the UI element boundaries. The quadrant is represented by Align constants corner constants. Possible return values are
      • Align.topLeft
      • Align.topRight
      • Align.bottomLeft
      • Align.bottomRight
      Parameters:
      mousePos - The position of the mouse, relative to the UI stage, meaning 0,0 is bottom-left regardless of GameCamera projection.
      Returns:
      The quadrant in which the mouse position is located.
      See Also:
      • Align
